column4: Sounds to me like tajen's files were probably on the NTFS system though
depends on how you format ;)
there is a ppa for it
nice :)
I don't see how -f install is going to do anything for him.
it will pull down the required deps (assuming they are available) to [f]ix the issue
There is no such package as 'python3.1'.  That's his problem.
it may just be python or something else, the manifest in the deb will tell the OS what it needs
The package name is just python3.  The rest is in the version string only.
Right, I know that.  The deb he has is wrong.  It has a Depends line programmed in that is not satisfiable.
lets see if the command works first
lets see instead of assuming
if it doesn't then we can move in a different way to if it does
There was a package named python3.1 in 10.04, which is what the deb was built for, but it no longer exists as such on 11.10.
I see
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python3.1/3.1.3-1ubuntu1/+build/2310554   seems one was built in March this year. Is this the same?

The reason being that Oneric has python3.2.  python3 is a metapackage that refers to the current version, and is what should be used as a dependency as such.  They skipped that step and depended directly, thus the problem.
ahh, that makes sense
thanks for clearing it up :)
See http://packages.ubuntu.com/lucid/python3 vs. http://packages.ubuntu.com/oneiric/python3
as long as people can explain stuff I'm up for learning :)
